micro_X documentation

API Reference

async modules.ai_handler.explain_linux_command_with_ai(command_to_explain: str, config_param: dict, append_output_func) → str | None[source]

Uses an AI model to explain a given Linux command.

Parameters:

  • command_to_explain – The command string to be explained.

  • config_param – The main application configuration object.

  • append_output_func – A reference to UIManager.append_output for UI updates.

Returns:

The AI-generated explanation as a string, or a fallback message/None on error.

async modules.ai_handler.get_validated_ai_command(human_query: str, config_param: dict, append_output_func, get_app_func) → tuple[str | None, str | None][source]

Translates a natural language query into a validated shell command.

This function orchestrates a multi-step process: 1. It tries the ‘primary_translator’ AI to get a command. 2. If successful, it validates the command using

is_valid_linux_command_according_to_ai.

  1. If the primary translator or validation fails, it can fall back to a ‘direct_translator’ AI if configured.

  2. This cycle repeats for a configured number of attempts.

Parameters:

  • human_query – The user’s natural language query.

  • config_param – The main application configuration object.

  • append_output_func – A reference to UIManager.append_output for UI updates.

  • get_app_func – A reference to UIManager.get_app_instance for UI invalidation.

Returns:

A tuple containing (validated_command, raw_ai_response). The command is None if no valid command could be produced. The raw response is the last candidate from the AI.

async modules.ai_handler.is_valid_linux_command_according_to_ai(command_text: str, config_param: dict) → bool | None[source]

Asks the Validator AI model if the given text is a likely Linux command.

Performs multiple validation attempts as configured and returns a boolean based on a majority vote of the AI’s ‘yes’/’no’ responses.

Parameters:

  • command_text – The string to validate.

  • config_param – The main application configuration object.

Returns:

True if the AI considers it a command, False if not. None if the result is inconclusive after all attempts.
